intro: Tetranthera wightiana, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of stinging nettles. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves with fine, stinging hairs that can cause irritation upon contact. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and are typically wind-pollinated. Tetranthera wightiana is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and thickets.
